content: what do you think about doing something similar to what we are doing for MCPs
so we can automatically add a to-announce label on accepted FCPs
and then I can implement on triagebot a search for those new accepted FCPs to be able to add them to the compiler meeting agenda
right now I can do it, as that PR was merged but I'd need to manually remove the old news

hm so I'm of two minds. I think to-announce seems fine (though we may want like to-announce-lang to-announce-compiler or something)

But -- more broadly, if there's a long period of time post-FCP conclusion that we're not moving on the issue, we should probably just drop the FCP labeling?
I was more thinking to drop the to-announce but the rest of the process I'm not sure how it works
I just figured to-announce is sort of an internal label used by wg-prioritization
@nikomatsakis right, I think you guys originally created it for MCPs on the compiler-team repo, now we're extending it further for FCPs on the rust repo
